headline: Assessing Dell Technologies (DELL) Valuation After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: Dell Technologies (DELL) has drawn fresh attention after its recent share price pullback, with the stock down about 5% over the past month and about 19% over the past 3 months. See our latest analysis for Dell Technologies. That pullback comes after a strong run, with Dell’s 1 year total shareholder return of 11.93% and very large 3 and 5 year total shareholder returns. However, the 90 day share price return of a 19.34% decline suggests momentum has recently faded, despite a latest share...

headline: US IT hardware stocks fall as Morgan Stanley turns cautious on sector
summary: U.S. IT hardware stocks fell on Tuesday after Morgan Stanley downgraded its view on the ​industry, warning that companies could drastically reduce their spending ‌budgets as enterprise demand slows and component costs rise. U.S.-listed shares of Logitech ‌and NetApp dropped 6.2% and about 3.8% respectively in premarket trading after the Wall Street brokerage slashed its rating on both companies to "underweight" from "equal-weight". Morgan Stanley reduced its rating on CDW Corporation to "equal-weight" ⁠from "overweight", sending its shares ‌down 2.1%.

content.title: US IT hardware stocks fall as Morgan Stanley turns cautious on sector

Morgan Stanley reduced its rating on CDW Corporation to "equal-weight" ⁠from "overweight", sending its shares ‌down 2.1%.

headline: US IT hardware stocks fall as Morgan Stanley warns of slowing demand
summary: U.S. IT hardware stocks fell on Tuesday after Morgan Stanley downgraded the sector, warning companies could sharply cut ​spending as enterprise demand slows and component costs rise amid broader ‌economic uncertainty. U.S.-listed shares of Logitech and NetApp dropped about 4.5% and 4% respectively in premarket trading after ‌the Wall Street brokerage cut both to "underweight" from "equal-weight." Morgan Stanley also lowered its rating on CDW to "equal-weight" from "overweight," sending its shares down 2.3%.

content.title: US IT hardware stocks fall as Morgan Stanley warns of slowing demand
content.summary: U.S. IT hardware stocks fell on Tuesday after Morgan Stanley downgraded the sector, warning companies could sharply cut ​spending as enterprise demand slows and component costs rise amid broader ‌economic uncertainty. U.S.-listed shares of Logitech and NetApp dropped about 4.5% and 4% respectively in premarket trading after ‌the Wall Street brokerage cut both to "underweight" from "equal-weight." Morgan Stanley also lowered its rating on CDW to "equal-weight" from "overweight," sending its shares down 2.3%.

headline: US IT hardware stocks tumble as Morgan Stanley flags slowing demand
summary: U.S. IT hardware stocks dropped on Tuesday after Morgan Stanley downgraded the sector, warning of ​slowing demand as companies rein in spending amid economic ‌uncertainty and rising component costs. The Wall Street brokerage said corporate technology leaders dialing back ‌hardware spending plans adds to existing concerns over higher input costs and supply bottlenecks, cutting its industry view to "cautious" from "in line." "A 'perfect storm' of slowing demand, input cost inflation and rich valuations is emerging, leading us ⁠to get more defensive ‌into 2026," the analysts wrote.

"A 'perfect storm' of slowing demand, input cost inflation and rich valuations is emerging, leading us ⁠to get more defensive ‌into 2026," the analysts wrote.
